newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ARA bunkers steady, second day of good volumes.
newsitem.headline: ARA bunkers steady, second day of good volumes.

text.p: Rotterdam bunker prices were broadly steady on Friday, another active day, while prices rose slightly in most other European ports.
Rotterdam 380 CST bunkers held around $90 fob despite a slight weakening of the barge market. Even so, bunkers were still only about $1 higher than the average barge price.
Suppliers reported the second consecutive day of healthy volumes, reaching around 20,000 tonnes, after almost 30,000 tonnes on Thursday.
"Some people are buying ahead of Easter. Others simply had to buy to cover delayed requirements," one supplier said.
Hamburg prices were broadly stable, but at around $5 above Rotterdam, failed to attract many buyers.
Mediterranean fuel oil bunkers mostly gained $1 a tonne. Few suppliers reported much business.
Fujairah fuel oil softened by $1/$2. Few ships were fixed as most shipowners believed prices would weaken further at the start of next week.
